events.title: Edward White's First American Spacewalk
events.description: American astronaut Edward H. White II performs the first American spacewalk during the Gemini 4 mission, spending about 23 minutes outside the spacecraft.
events.significance: Marked a significant achievement in the US space program during the space race, demonstrating extravehicular activity capabilities.

events.title: Tiananmen Square Massacre
events.description: Chinese military forces violently suppress pro-democracy protests in Tiananmen Square, Beijing, leading to hundreds if not thousands of deaths.
events.significance: A pivotal moment in modern Chinese history highlighting government repression and human rights issues.

events.title: Hindenburg Disaster
events.description: The German passenger airship LZ 129 Hindenburg catches fire and is destroyed during its attempt to dock in New Jersey, killing 36 people.
events.significance: Effectively ended the era of passenger airship travel due to safety concerns.

events.title: Scottsboro Boys Arrest
events.description: Nine African American teenagers are arrested in Alabama, accused of raping two white women, in a case that becomes a landmark in civil rights and legal history.
events.significance: Exposed deep racial injustices in the American legal system and set precedents for fair trials.

events.title: Kennedy Marries Jacqueline Bouvier
events.description: John F. Kennedy, future President of the United States, marries Jacqueline Bouvier in a widely publicized ceremony.
events.significance: The couple became a prominent political and cultural symbol in America during the 1960s.
